p: Oliveria decumbens Vent. ( Carum orientalum (DC) Hiroe) is an annual herb in the family Apiaceae which is distributed in south-east Anatolia, Syria, Iraq, and Iran ( 1). In Iran, the plant grows in limited areas of the south and the west, and known as Moshkoorak, Den or Denak ( 2). This herb has been used in the traditional or folk medicine treatment of a broad spectrum of disorders such as indigestion, diarrhea, abdominal pains, fever, and infections ( 3). Our studies of traditional Persian medical resources indicate that this herb as “Shavasara or Moshk choopan” has been used as a liver and heart tonic as well as a CNS stimulant ( 4- 6).
